ai.summary: A gentle 5.6 km ridge walk along Wenlock Edge to Lea Quarry, offering limestone escarpment scenery, wildflower banks, and far-reaching views. Suitable for beginners and families seeking a scenic half-day hike.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined paths along a limestone ridge with compact gravel and limestone pavement. Gentle to moderate climbs with occasional rocky steps. Some exposed sections on the crest; route passes through pasture and small woodland, with scenic views across the countryside.
ai.safety_notes: Weather on ridges can change quickly; check the forecast before setting out. Wear sturdy walking boots and bring warm, waterproof clothing. Stay on the paths and be cautious near the edge on exposed sections. Navigation aids (map/compass or GPS) are recommended; mobile signal may be limited along the ridge. Carry water and snacks, and plan for daylight hours. If walking with dogs, keep them under control and away from quarry faces and livestock.
recommended_gear: Lightweight waterproof jacket and extra layers
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for Lea Quarry Walk, offering milder weather and better visibility. Summer provides long daylight for a relaxed pace; autumn brings changing colors. Winter visits are possible but can be windy, muddy, and daylight is shorter—plan accordingly.
